paragraphs: Our company primarily engages in the agency and distribution of semiconductor-related components, with no manufacturing activities. Each operating site is an office building; therefore, waste generated during operations mainly consists of office waste and domestic waste produced by employees. This waste is handled in centralized garbage sorting areas established by the building management committee. In addition, the Neihu headquarters warehouse occasionally generates recyclable waste such as pallets, packaging materials, and electronic components, which are collected and processed by certified waste disposal vendors.

paragraphs: To minimize waste generation, we promote resource conservation and efficient garbage sorting. Packaging materials required for logistics, such as cartons, fillers, and foam, are recycled and reused for outbound packaging, implementing a resource recycling policy. Recycled waste is managed centrally, with waste quantities and disposal data regularly recorded, and certified waste recycling companies are commissioned for disposal.

To conserve resources, the office uses paper certified under the Forest Stewardship Council (PEFC) for office supplies. Waste paper is reused and double-sided printing is encouraged. Discarded paper is handled by compliant environmental companies and processed into paper products via hydropulping to meet circular economy goals while reducing air pollution and carbon emissions. A total of 15 boxes of waste paper were processed by hydropulping. Additionally, we promote electronic document approval and electronic invoicing to reduce paper usage. In 2023, a total of 154,332 electronic approvals were completed across the group, saving approximately 474,526 sheets of A4 paper, equating to approximately 56.94 trees saved compared to the previous year (2022), with paper savings of around 196,471 sheets of A4. Future efforts will continue to promote paper reduction.

props.text: Tree Reduction Since Electronic Processing Implementation in 2021:

paragraphs: The warehouse originally used wooden pallets. To reduce waste, metal and plastic pallets were purchased in 2017, significantly reducing the amount of discarded pallets. As of 2023, no new pallets have been procured for storage operations, and wooden pallets used for incoming goods continue to be reused for outbound shipments.

We promote office recycling and reuse, encourage employees to appreciate resources, and protect the environment by starting from daily habits. Small recycling stations are set up within the company to improve environmental awareness and increase waste recycling rates.
Products are shipped to clients with original manufacturer packaging whenever possible to minimize the use of additional packaging materials.
